title: NeuroPulse: Ultra-Low Power Neural Data Compression for Brain Interfaces
product_description: NeuroPulse compresses neural data at the sensor level, reducing power use and data bottlenecks in next-generation Brain-Computer Interfaces (BCIs). Targeting neuroprosthetic manufacturers, research labs, and wearable tech developers, it enables real-time spike detection with high signal fidelity.
implementation: The system integrates a high-density sensor array with comparators, a global ramp Digital-to-Analog Converter (DAC), and wired-OR readouts. A centralized decoder employing Gray counting and a 3-tap Finite Impulse Response (FIR) filter applies on-chip pulse-position modulation to compress significant neural events while minimizing redundancy.
differentiation: NeuroPulse excels in converting raw neural signals into compressed, high-fidelity data in real time. Its on-chip, event-driven pulse-position modulation reduces energy consumption and processing load. This collision-resistant decoding approach delivers robust performance over conventional methods.
